We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Structural Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki,&nbsp;Lagos
Reports To: Head Designing Team or Managing Director (MD)

Position Overview


	The Structural Engineer occupies a pivotal position in the realm of construction, championing the integrity, safety, and sustainability of the built environment.
	This role demands not only a deep reservoir of technical knowledge but also the finesse to collaborate harmoniously with a diverse cast of stakeholders throughout the dynamic life cycle of construction projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Design Development: Innovate and craft intricate structural designs and blueprints utilizing advanced engineering software, ensuring each creation aligns with the highest standards of codes and regulations.
	Structural Analysis: Conduct comprehensive examinations of structural systems, meticulously assessing their strength, stability, and endurance against a myriad of conditions and loads to ensure robust performance.
	Project Oversight: Steer construction projects seamlessly from conception to realization, safeguarding adherence to design blueprints and upholding stringent safety protocols.
	Collaboration: Engage with architects, civil engineers, contractors, and project managers in a synergistic manner, ensuring that structural designs harmoniously integrate with the overall architectural vision.
	Material Selection: Diligently assess and recommend the most suitable construction materials, weighing factors such as cost, performance, and environmental impact to foster sustainable choices.
	Site Inspections: Undertake regular site visits, immersing yourself in the ongoing work to monitor progress, uphold quality standards, and ensure compliance with engineering specifications and safety guidelines.
	Documentation: Compile and preserve meticulous documentation, including thorough design calculations, detailed reports, and clear project correspondence, ensuring a comprehensive project archive.
	Client Liaison: Foster strong relationships with clients to gain insights into their aspirations, provide regular updates on project progress, and address any technical inquiries with clarity and professionalism.


Qualifications


	A bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field is essential, with a master&rsquo;s degree preferred for those seeking a more advanced understanding.
	A valid Professional Engineer license or a certification as a Structural Engineer (COREN) is a prerequisite.
	A robust background with a minimum of 3-10 years of hands-on experience in structural engineering across diverse construction projects.
	Skilled in utilizing engineering design software such as AutoCAD, Revit, SAP2000, or equivalent tools that enhance design precision and efficiency.
	A readiness to embrace changing project demands, regulations, and technologies, allowing for agile responses to evolving situations
	Mastery of structural engineering principles, building materials, and design methodologies is essential for success in this role
	Swift and effective resolution to engineering challenges and conflicts that may arise during the course of projects.
	Strong capability to collaborate within multidisciplinary teams, fostering an uplifting and productive work atmosphere.
	Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to articulate complex technical concepts clearly to clients and team members.
	Possess the acumen to dissect complex structures and design challenges, applying critical thinking to forge effective solutions.
	Demonstrated ability to navigate project timelines, budgets, and resources, consistently delivering high-quality outcomes.
	Exemplary precision in scrutinizing designs and calculations to guarantee accuracy and compliance with regulatory frameworks.
	Thorough familiarity with local, state, and national building codes, safety regulations, and engineering standards is critical.
	A strong commitment to lifelong learning, ensuring continuous professional development and staying ahead of industry trends and technological advancements.


Benefits


	A transparent compensation framework.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to:&nbsp;hr@carrillionng.com.ng&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;hrcarrillionng@zohomail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

title: Job Vacancies at SEID HQ
content:
SEID HQ - Marketing Communications Firm..Amplifying Industry Enablers & Telling The New African Story Digital Marketing | Brand Storytelling | Policy Marketing

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Content Writer - Business Focus

Job Location: Admiralty Way - Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Content Writer with a strong background in business writing.
	In this role, you will create compelling, informative, and engaging content tailored to our business audiences.
	The ideal candidate should have experience crafting articles, website copy, and other marketing materials that convey complex information clearly and effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Research and write high-quality, original business content.
	Collaborate with other team members to align content with business goals.
	Translate technical or industry-specific topics into clear, engaging content
	Adhere to the company’s tone of brand guidelines and messaging framework
	Proofread and self-edit for clarity, grammar, and accuracy
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends and integrate insights into content
	Optimise content for SEO best practices using targeted keywords.
	Track performance metrics and revise content strategies as needed


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field
	2+ years of professional content writing experience, ideally in B2B or business-focused environments
	A portfolio showcasing business content is required


Skills:


	Strong research and analytical skills
	Excellent command of English grammar, style, and tone
	Proven ability to write clearly and concisely for a professional audience
	Familiarity with content marketing strategy and SEO principles
	Strong time-management and organisational skills
	Ability to adapt writing style for various industries and audiences.


Method of Aplication
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: people@seid.in using "Content Writer (Business Focus)" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Art Director / Graphics Designer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid (2 days onsite)

Job Description


	Create bold, innovative, and impactful visual concepts that tell compelling stories.
	Develop campaign visuals from idea to execution.
	Stay ahead of design trends, competitor work, and creative technologies.
	Collaborate with copywriters, strategists, and cross-functional teams.
	Enhance storytelling through motion graphics, photography, and videography.
	Translate consumer insights into visually engaging, customer-centric designs.
	Produce high-quality creative assets (concepts, 2D assets, UI, marketing materials).


Requirements


	4+ years in art direction, design, and visual storytelling (agency or in-house).
	Strong portfolio with digital, print, and motion design work.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and related tools.
	Strong grasp of typography, colour theory, composition, and design principles.
	Experience in creative workflows, print, and digital asset management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: people@seid.in using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Operations Manager (with Business Development Experience)

Job Location: Admiralty Way, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid

About the Role


	We are looking for an experienced Operations Manager with a strong background in business development to oversee daily operations, optimise processes, and drive growth for our fast-growing food chain.
	The ideal candidate will combine operational excellence with the ability to identify and unlock new business opportunities.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day operations across multiple outlets, ensuring smooth service delivery and customer satisfaction.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and scale sustainably.
	Monitor supply chain, inventory, logistics, and vendor management to ensure seamless operations.
	Collaborate with the leadership team to identify, evaluate, and execute new business opportunities and partnerships.
	Expand the company’s footprint by scouting new locations, partnerships, and strategic collaborations.
	Analyse performance metrics (sales, customer feedback, operational efficiency) and recommend improvements.
	Ensure compliance with food safety, hygiene, and regulatory standards.
	Recruit, train, and lead operations staff to deliver on performance goals.
	Drive innovation in customer experience, delivery models, and operational processes.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	5+ years of experience in Operations Management, preferably in the food, hospitality, or retail industry.
	Proven track record in business development and growing customer base/revenue.
	Strong understanding of food chain logistics, supply chain, and vendor management.
	Excellent leadership, organisational, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong business acumen with the ability to analyse data and make informed decisions.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Tech-savvy, with experience using POS systems, ERP/operations tools, and CRM platforms.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to play a key role in scaling a fast-growing food brand.
	Dynamic and innovative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: people@seid.in using "Operations Manager Application" as the subject of the email.

	Approved inception report and work plan within the first month.

	Training manuals and workshop reports.
	Final project report and evaluation inputs.
	Functional referral pathways and coordination mechanisms.


Note

Job Position: Project Manager

The Project Manager will be responsible for:


	Provide overall leadership and strategic direction for the project, ensuring alignment with SWODEN Nigeria & Irish Aid’s mission and project objectives.
	Develop and oversee the implementation of comprehensive project work plans, budgets, and operational strategies.
	Manage project resources, including human resources, finances, and assets, ensuring efficient and accountable utilization.
	Supervise project staff (Education Officer, Livelihood Officer, GBV Sensitization Officer, etc.), fostering a cohesive and high-performing team.
	Ensure timely and high-quality implementation of all project activities, including girl-child education reintegration, women's skills training, economic empowerment, and GBV sensitization.
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with government agencies, local authorities, community leaders, traditional institutions, and partner organizations.
	Oversee project monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning (MEAL) activities, ensuring accurate data collection, analysis, and reporting.
	Identify and mitigate project risks, developing contingency plans as necessary.
	Prepare and submit timely, accurate, and comprehensive narrative and financial reports to SWODEN Nigeria management and donors.
	Represent SWODEN Nigeria at relevant coordination meetings, workshops, and forums at the LGA and state levels.
	Ensure compliance with donor regulations, organizational policies, and relevant national laws.
	Promote gender equality, safeguarding, and protection principles across all project interventions.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Master's Degree in Project Management, Development Studies, Social Sciences, Education, Business Administration, or a related field. A relevant Bachelor's degree with extensive experience may be considered.
	Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in managing complex development projects, preferably in the education, livelihoods, or protection sectors.
	Proven experience in project cycle management (PCM), including planning, implementation, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting.
	Strong financial management skills, including budget development, tracking, and oversight.
	Demonstrated leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and mentor staff.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and representation skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a multi-cultural environment and with diverse stakeholders.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
	Proficiency in English and Hausa (oral and written) is mandatory.
	Advanced computer skills, especially in Microsoft Office Suite and project management software.


Desirable Qualifications / Skills:


	Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification.
	Experience working specifically in Jigawa State or similar contexts in Northern Nigeria.
	Experience with donor reporting requirements for major international donors.
	Knowledge of humanitarian principles and protection standards.
	Experience in conducting context analysis and conflict sensitivity assessments


Responsibilities & Deliverables:


	Approved inception report and work plan within the first month.
	Monthly and quarterly narrative reports.
	Training manuals and workshop reports.
	Final project report and evaluation inputs.
	Functional referral pathways and coordination mechanisms.


Note


	SWODEN is an equal opportunity employer. Female candidates and persons from marginalized groups are strongly encouraged to apply.
	For more information about SWODEN, please visit our website www.swoden.org or contact us directly via email: swodeninfo@yahoo.com
	Thank you for your interest in working with SWODEN.

Internal Control Officer Job at Elizabeth Maddeux




        
    

        
        Elizabeth Maddeux provides a range of human resources solutions designed to empower your workforce, enhance technical proficiency, refine soft skills, and accelerateorganizational growth for better impacts by enhancing organizational dynamics through a well-rounded and robust human resource intervention.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a meticulous and objective Internal Auditor to monitor and evaluate internal controls, ensure accuracy in financial processes, and enforce compliance with operational standards.
	The Internal Control Officer will serve as a watchdog for business integrity, process effectiveness, and risk mitigation.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Audits:


	Conduct internal audits on procurement, production, sales, inventory, payroll, and cash handling.
	Evaluate efficiency of operations and identify opportunities for cost savings.


Financial Controls & Risk Analysis:


	Verify accuracy of financial statements and general ledger entries.
	Conduct risk assessments and fraud investigations.
	Ensure segregation of duties and implement internal checks.


Inventory & Production Audits:


	Conduct routine spot-checks on inventory levels (raw, WIP, finished goods).
	Match inventory records with sales and production logs.
	Monitor bakery yield metrics and ingredient usage.


Process & Policy Audits:


	Review SOPs across all departments and identify compliance gaps.
	Recommend improvements to enhance control and efficiency.
	Conduct training and sensitization sessions for factory staff.


Regulatory & Tax Compliance Review:


	Validate statutory filings and tax payments.
	Check compliance with local labor laws, food safety regulations, and corporate governance codes.


Reporting:


	Submit timely, objective, and actionable audit reports with clear risk indicators.
	Track and follow up on audit recommendations to ensure full implementation.


Process Development:


	Establish audit documentation standards and reporting templates.
	Build risk management frameworks and internal control matrices.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND in Accounting, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum 3 - 5 years of audit or internal control experience, preferably in FMCG/production.
	Professional qualification (ICAN, ACCA, CIA) is highly desirable.
	Strong attention to details.
	Sound knowledge of audit principles, internal controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
	Strong ethics, confidentiality, and analytical skills.


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@elizabethmaddeux.com using “Internal Control Officer-FMCG” as the subject of the email.

Quality Control Assistant Job at Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc has been a part of the lives of Nigerians at home and abroad. Our global vision is to be a leading foods company in Africa providing high quality and affordable products in the most convenient ways to consumers through world class brands like Golden Penny Flour, Golden Penny Semovita, Goldenvita, Golden Pasta and Golden Noodles. The Company's flagship brand, Golden Penny, remains one of the best known and the preferred brands amongst bakers, confectioneries and consumers in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Assistant

Job Location: Ibadan - Oyo / Kaduna / Kano

Purpose
     

            
    




	The Quality Control Assistant supports the production team by ensuring that products meet established quality standards.
	This role involves daily inspection of materials and nearly finished goods, monitoring compliance with safety and regulatory requirements, and contributing to continuous improvement efforts.


The Job


	Analyze samples of nearly finished products daily to confirm adherence to durability, safety, and specification standards before final production.
	Conduct routine testing and evaluation of materials, components, and environmental factors used during production to verify quality.
	Identify and troubleshoot customer complaints or internal issues related to product quality by reviewing the entire production process.
	Maintain accurate records of quality checks, test results, and findings in designated logs and quality control systems.
	Verify that all products and processes meet relevant local and industry-specific regulatory standards at all production stages.
	Periodically review and recommend updates to quality control procedures to enhance efficiency and reduce production disruptions.


Qualifications / Experience


	5 O’ level Credits including English & Mathematics in not more than two sittings.
	Minimum of two years' experience Preferably in a manufacturing setting.


The Person Must:


	Have good interpersonal and communication skills.
	Be adaptable and proactive in suggesting process improvements to enhance efficiency.
	Possess teamwork and interpersonal skills.
	Demonstrate good knowledge of quality assurance methods, tools, and industry standards.
